summary:
I am Iván Martínez, an Argentinian System Administrator professional located in the Netherlands. I am a technology enthusiast who loves reading and learning about infrastructure and emerging technologies. I am very interested in being part of projects that employ agile and DevOps methodologies and work with cloud-native techs.

I used to work as a Cloud Engineer at Edrans, the first company to be an AWS (Amazon Web Services) Premier Partner in Argentina. In this role, I help our clients design and deploy AWS solutions following cloud best practices. Besides that, working with our clients' developer teams is also part of my position, improving and troubleshooting their development and production environments.

Before Edrans, I worked as Operation Analyst at Wavy, a Movile company. There I learned a lot about telecommunication and mobile networking. My main tasks were monitoring our carriers' SMPP links and administration of our Southcone servers and services. 

Before Wavy, I worked at Grupo Most as System Administrator. It was my first job in IT, where I had my first interaction with Linux (I fell in love with it) and server administration in general. There I managed the services and infrastructure of Grupo Most and its clients.

It offers three services to its 6M+ users: sending money, requesting money, and paying with a QR code.

There comes a time in every start-up company when it is necessary to have a team with a narrower and more specific scope of responsibilities to achieve great results. That is where the role of DevSecOps is born in MODO. After almost a year of working as a DevOps Engineer, I took on the responsibility of building the foundations of this new team, being its first member.

Having the advantage of knowing the points of improvement in the security of MODO's infrastructure in AWS, we managed to define a roadmap where we prioritized our weaknesses, documented our security stack and processes, and automated the deployment of our solutions using mainly Terragrunt as an infrastructure-as-code tool.", 'title': 'Senior DevOps Engineer, Security', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Argentina', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'MODO', 'description': None, 'title': 'DevOps Engineer, Security', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Argentina', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'MODO', 'description': "When I talk about what a DevOps engineer does at MODO, I like to say that we wear three hats: the infrastructure engineer hat, the DevOps engineer hat, and finally, the production reliability hat.

When it comes to wearing the infrastructure engineer hat, we are responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining architecture solutions within AWS using Terraform as the infrastructure-as-code tool. Then comes the time of day when developers require the smoothest possible experience when deploying their applications to our Kubernetes clusters, and that's where the DevOps engineer hat comes in, which tries to improve deployment pipelines using GitHub Actions as a build and deployment tool. Finally comes the moment when the production environment requires constant support and improvement, and that's where we wear the reliability hat.", 'title': 'DevOps Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 290558, 'name': 'Edrans', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFshbYxTecnjQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1584327657195?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=DfGpd-T5l7_J_SOsQkElFjc_1WLjOfKVQCVJwRrSj8s', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/edrans/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Argentina', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Edrans', 'description': 'Edrans is an Argentinean company focused on providing professional services on AWS, being the first company in the country to achieve the Premier partner distinction.

I was part of four projects for three different clients. The first project dealt with the administration of productive services of a classified site with a presence in several Latin American countries. The next two consisted of migrations of productive infrastructure located on on-premise servers and Azure to AWS. And the last one was the implementation of infrastructure for machine learning workflows using Kubeflow. All these projects were carried out using Terraform as the infrastructure tool as code, and the concept of automation to the extreme along with accompanying the teams of each client to adopt the DevOps methodology in their daily operations.', 'title': 'Cloud Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 23766426, 'name': 'Wavy Global (now Sinch LatAm)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQG4n54BbpigPw/company-logo_400_400/0/1617041544025?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=7pSEhKSeZ9gSBodvn322KhQmQ-0b4Ah8jJOUsyzrXp8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/wavyglobal/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Argentina', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Wavy Global (now Sinch LatAm)', 'description': 'Wavy is a Brazilian company that brings together content operations, messaging, and mobile carrier businesses.
